column1: Bosscat Kitchen & Libations////Definitely not vegetarian friendly unless you're ok with just having a salad and maybe a side. I ordered the pimento cheese. It came to the table with what one would consider crackers or flattened stale bread. At no point would I ever call what I received toasted or close to being bread-like. The vegetables that accompanied this plate consisted of tomatoes and cucumber slices.  When asked if they could possibly add some other vegetable to this 11 dollar side
column2: the chef would not accommodate.  I find it hard to believe that the only "vegetables" in your kitchen are those which are mentioned above. The pimento cheese dip itself was just ok.
